headline: Chef John's Italian Meatballs
description: This Italian meatball recipe from Chef John uses a delicious mix of ground beef and pork, with added flavor from garlic, herbs, and Parmesan cheese.

video.description: See the secret to tender baked Italian meatballs.
video.name: How to Make Italian Meatballs

name: Chef John's Italian Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Cover a baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with cooking spray. Soak bread crumbs in milk in a small bowl for 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and continue cooking and stirring until onion is very tender, about 15 minutes more.

Gently stir beef and pork together in a large bowl. Add onions, bread crumb mixture, eggs, Parmesan cheese, parsley, garlic, salt, black pepper, Italian herb seasoning, and red pepper flakes; mix together using a rubber spatula until combined. Cover and refrigerate for about one hour.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Form mixture into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter; arrange in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I used all 80/20 beef because I didn't have ground pork on hand and the result was still a very tender and delicious meatball. I used convection baking and got a browned top without frying and didn't feel like I was missing out on anything. I'll make this recipe again.
Cooked meat balls in air fryer 12mins at200 came out brilliant did not use parmesan just used Sharp cheddar

These were the best meatballs I ever made. The flavor and texture are perfect. As a side note, please do not review recipes for which you have made changes in ingredients or amounts. At that point, you are not reviewing this recipe but your own.

Amazing! Flavorful and delicious. Dare I say these are better than my Mom’s? I used all beef since I didn’t have ground pork. Added some garlic powder, basil & oregano. I’ve never soaked the breadcrumbs in milk but I think I’ll continue doing that in the future. I baked these in the oven then tossed them in a pot of sauce. Great recipe!

This was a great recipe. I love it because it gave me a salt measurement and I didn't need to cook some meatball in advance. 1 tsp sale per pound of meat. I normally use everything else in the recipe but now I will remember the parmesan cheese and the salt ratio. Very tender, flavorful meatballs. And baking them makes them SO easy.
This has become my all time go to meatball recipe! It comes out tasty every time!!

These are great. I had about 2 1/2 pounds of ground beef and one pound of pork. I adjusted the proportions of the other ingredients accordingly but they came out a little too salty and peppery. That's on me and not the basic recipe. I will definitely make this again but will watch the salt and red pepper next time. I also used a box grater on the onions so just added them raw to the mix. I'm a freak for smoked paprika, so yes, that was added as well. With the volume of meat I used, a large Kitchen Aid mix made short work of the blending process. Good eats.

A huge hit at the family Christmas dinner! My changes: Use 1/2 cup parsley, as recommended in the video. Double the garlic, Italian seasoning, red pepper flakes, and cheese (I used Pecorino Romano, because that's what I had on hand). Bake for 25 minutes for 350, then broil for five minutes or so until browned. For the sauce, I combined a cup of sriracha ketchup, 1/4 cup water, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 3 tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1.5 tbsp Worcestershire, 1 large minced shallot, 2 cloves minced garlic, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir and simmer for 10 minutes or so, until slightly thickened. I might make this into a meatloaf next!
Delicious, thank you!
I had to add extra bread crumbs . It is very wet

I have to admit I made 3 changes. I used 1 lb 88 % ground beef and 1 lb mild Italian sausage. Because I did this, I used only 1/2 the red pepper flakes and they have the perfect heat for us. I only had Italian bread crumbs so I used those. So flavorful, moist, and tender. I cooked to 165-170 degrees internal temp(instant read thermometer). Took about 15 minutes in my oven. Mine were about 1 1/2" diameter raw. This made 68 meatballs. Once done, I promptly ate 3 right off the pan! Yum. I couldn't eat just one!
We have had this so many times. Sometimes I just have ground beef and everybody loves it. I have the link saved in my emails
I just made this recipe tonight and it’s the best meatballs I’ve ever eaten!!!
I will try it. I always bake my meatballs. Never fry. They get too tough. To the lady who didn’t like her baked meatballs I used beef though. Or Italian sausage.
The best meatballs I've ever made. I ground up half a pound of bacon and used 1 1/2 pounds of ground beef, instead of 1/1 beef/pork.
Awesome!
Best meatball recipe!!!

Nov 2022 - followed recipe except for going lighter on the salt and the red pepper flakes for our family. Yield was approx 51 meatballs and were delicious! Would highly recommend to make ahead, bake & freeze to have on hand for reheating!

This is the absolute best recipe ever! I think it's important, though, to use the type of canned tomatoes that he recommends. They're $6+ a can vs. $1+ a can for what the grocers store carries. I also use wagyu ground beef, which would make them that much more flavourful.
I make these ALL the time. I use "HOT Sausage with the beef. SUPERB!!! I'll never go back or use any other recipe!!! Check out Chef John's Spaghetti Sauce also!!!
I’ve made these many times but I doubled the cheese and Italian seasoning also the bread and garlic Plus added lemon zest and pinch of nutmeg

Made these recently and was impressed with the texture of the meatballs. Their consistency was light and moist; not dense at all. However, i did not feel they had much italian flavor. The small amount of dried italian seasoning, crushed garlic, and 2 T of parm cheese did not impart enough flavoring. I will definitely make these again but add more dried herbs and garlic.

As with ALL of Chef John's recipes, this was perfect !! I did use hot sausage and added in some Frozen chopped green/red pepper/ onion blend, cause I had it in freezer and extra garlic just to our taste! Do watch the salt, as the parm is salty too. Be sure to refrigerate mixture well THAT IS KEY - I actually make the day before I bake off for GAME DAY and cover in a great home made marinara. Roll Tide !

Made these to add to a lasagna dish I’m making and they were absolutely delicious. I might suggest backing off the salt if you’re adding the optional parmesan cheese tho. It was a bit more than we were prepared for over at our place.
Delicious, moist, and flavorful. My family loved this recipe!

I’ve been making this recipe for years, and I’m finally leaving a review!! My family loves these. So easy and flavorful. I’ve doubled the batch and froze some and they are just as good as making them fresh. My college kids ask for these when they are home for holidays. Thank you Chef John!

These were delicious!!, in spite of forgetting the parsley :/ Tender and flavorful…loved the addition of red pepper flakes, but did only put half the amount, as I was making these for a family with littles. Otherwise made as directed, and will definitely choose to make them again.
I made this, but I modified the recipe to swap the "Italian herbs" for some Rosemary, Sage, and Thyme, for use in a beef-based stew, and it worked beautifully!

This here is a GREAT recipe! I made this many times, and its always my go to for its simplicity and amazing flavor. Sometimes I use all beef, or whatever meat is on sale and it never fails. Everyone loves them. I triple my recipe and with leftovers I make sandwiches for work, add some fun dressing a slice of sharp cheese and Bam! I will be very busy tomorrow, so I am making my mix tonight, place in a plastic bag into the fridge and tomorrows prep time will be a breeze. My dogs never refuse the scraps and once even the raccoons got a meal. Don't hesitate and make it, and add whatever you like to make it yours. I do extra garlic sometimes. I always bake them and when cooked I add to my homemade sauce, and that's a big Ohhhh Myyyyy G_ _!!!!!!!!!
This is AMAZING 😍😍 it's so tender and juicy! but it's just a bit bland for my taste so i added more herbs, pepper, and beef stock powder, but nevertheless the recipe is so amazing! Thankyou.

The meatballs are wonderful! We are kicking ourselves that we didn’t make a double batch! But how could we know they’d be so full of flavor, so juicy, so tender? Didn’t change a thing which for us is unusual. But this recipe just sounded right from the get-go. Oh, yes, didn’t fry the onions…we like the raw taste. Great going, Chef!
Did not have much flavor. Recommend 90/10 meat to cut down on fat. Used pinch of salt.
Forgot to add garlic, used dry parsley, used parchment paper for easy clean up for the compost. High school water polo team didn’t seem to mind.
Simple and easy to make. I thought they were a little bland, and figure they would be a bit better with more parmesan and less parsley. Will make them again to see.
These meatballs were awesome! I added more breadcrumbs than the recipe called for, left out the red pepper flakes. Will be making these again. I made Homemade Spaghetti sauce to go with them.

This came out great! I have, in the past, stuck to the Meatball Nirvana recipe and I took a chance on this recipe instead. Oh my, these meatballs are really tender. I mostly made them by the recipe (I scaled up to 75 servings with 5 pounds of meat). But, instead of the ground pork, I used 2 pounds of pork sweet/mild sausage instead. I also accidentally added a half small can of tomato paste. I fried it with the onions after they were almost done cooking down. I was seriously trying to stick to the recipe but I put the tomato paste in from habit, LOL. That turned out great though. I also made them small as that is our preference. 20 minutes total bake time. 140 meatballs for the freezer. Yeah me :)
I used cracker crumbs and grated the onion put them in raw
The best!!

This was unreal!! So flavorful,nice amount of moisture so they were not dry at all! My whole family loved them! I didn't have any pork to add so it was only beef used, but so tasty!!! This has already been requested again and we only made the first round last night!!

I have never left a review. I cannot stand when people change things about the recipe and review the newly revised version. I followed this recipe completely.... but I don't eat pork so I did all ground beef. Thats the only change!!! I followed everything else and the recipe was awesome! These things straight up melt in your mouth. I have had a terrible day, everything has gone wrong, I cried in the bank. these meatballs though... they made me forget for a bit. honest. you guys gotta try it, and for real just follow the recipe you don't need to make any tweaks! A part of me was like 'maybe I should brown them in a pan first and then bake' but omg I'm so glad I did not do that. just throw them in the oven and forget about them for 18-20ish min and you're GOLDEN. (if you're like me and terrible at timing things, right before I rolled up the meatballs I started heating up sauce and some water for noodles. then I put the meatballs in. after meatballs go in, wait for water to boil, and then add pasta. only keep sauce on low heat! When the meatballs were done everything was ready about the same time so it was all hot! this may sound like common sense for some, but some people are just learning how to cook like I am!!!)
Easy and delicious. Even the grandkids love them which is rare! Just froze half a batch for a quick weekday spaghetti and meatball dinner. Thanks for a great recipe.
My second time making these yummy meatballs. I doubled the receip cooked them and froze them. I made the New York times Mariana and basil sauce froze that. Make a delicious fast meal.

Love, this recipe. I made it simple .. I mix all the ingredients in the bowl , form into a slight smaller than a baseball into the cookie sheet lined with parchment paper and baked in 350 degrees for 20/30 minutes and turn the oven heat to 425 degrees for about 5 minutes or less till the meatballs turn brown and the inside juicy. My husband raved about it. The best meatball he’s ever eaten. I can’t wait to add this to my own homemade spaghetti. Thank you for the recipe. We’ll be making this again.

OK… today was my 10th or 11th time making these meatballs… safe to assume I LOVE this recipe, with one slight modification. The recipe is great, sweating the onions and pre-soaking the breadcrumbs in milk is old school… what I do is keep the meat quantity the same, but increase all other ingredients by 1.5 times. I just feel it makes for a tastier, more flavorful meatball. Try it… I’m a fan!
Amazing meatballs!!!! Family favorite. Thanks you for this recipe. It's a hit every time.
So good, I always make a double batch.

Awesome meatballs. Just followed the recipe using beef pork & veal. I had trouble with the bread crumbs a couple of yes previously. Now I just add bread crumbs to milk slowly to achieve the consistency I want & Wala perfect tasty meatballs
I have made these many times and always get asked for the recipe. When I am short of time I put the onion through my good processor and add it are to the meatballs mixture.

This is my go-to meatball recipe. My family absolutely adores it. I always have leftovers, though, because this recipe makes a LOT of meatballs, so I have stopped buying frozen ones from the store in favor if freezing my leftovers from this recipe.
Absolutely delicious! I made it exactly to Chef John’s recipe. Definitely 5 ⭐️‘s!!!!! Thank you
Best meatballs ever, threw them in the air fryer at 380 for 12 minutes and came out perfect.
I followed the recipe to the letter
This is my go to for family gatherings or if I’m just feeling like meatballs. Every last one is eaten every time!!!

Aaaaamazing! I took reviewers advice and used 1/3 cup of milk. Everything else as is. But the best advice I can give is if you have convection roast on your oven…use it! They browned up beautifully with no puddles.
I have tried a lot of meatball recipes, but this one is by far the best. I have not used another recipe since. The flavor is so authentic and so delicious. You can not go wrong with this one.
My family’s favorite meatballs! So easy too! I’ve made it with pork/beef mixture, Italian sausage/beef mixture and all beef (80/20) and it’s great every time. Thanks Chef John!
I added almost a cup of Parmesan Asiago cheese. I increased my Italian Seasoning to 1 T. I decreased the onion to 2.T

This is the BEST meatball recipe I have found. I’ve made them five times, exactly as written and they turn out perfect every time. The flavor is amazing. I triple this recipe and make 90 meatballs and freeze them in one meal portions. It’s so easy to take out a pack of meatballs from the freezer and cook up homemade spaghetti and meatball meal for my family. I defrost and add them to Raos Marinara. Simmer. Top on spaghetti. So simple and delicious.

I have a tip! Been making this exact recipe for years, but with 5min remaining, I move the rack up, and broil on high, a couple minutes , flip and broil the other side. They come out beautifully browned and still juicy.
They are excellent. My husband loves. :)
Excellent. It was too hot to use the oven so I cooked them on the stove top. They were delicious!
Best meatballs with a slight kick, everyone in my family (6 kids and husband) loved them and asked me to make them again and again!
Had to bake em for about 25 minutes because I made them about 2inches instead of 1.5 Turned out delicious
Wouldn't change a thing - great plain or with a variety of dipping sauces.
These are easy and delicious. They really are like real Italian meatballs restaurant style! And they baked not fried. Thank you Chef John!
Delicious no changes. Great as is
I have probably made these a dozen times or more. I follow the recipe pretty much as written. They are delicious and also easy to prepare and easy to clean up.
Mouth watering and beyond words for how delicious. These meatballs are perfect. Used one batch for sweet and sour slow cooker and another for a marinara sauce.
These came out better than I expected, the kids all liked them.
Just finished a double batch..I didn’t change anything as far as ingredients. Very flavorful! I would definitely recommend.
Great recipe, very tasty also not difficult to execute and clean up was a breeze

I've never baked my meatballs in the oven. My mom always added them (raw) to her homemade marinara and cooked them on the stove for several hours. I do the same. The meatballs taste so much better. This is a delicious recipe! I didn't use red pepper flakes though. This recipe is a keeper. I will be making them again! Thanks Chef John!
Another great recipe from Chef John! Just follow directions and they turned out great!
i didn't have shredded parmesean i had greated and it was awesome still. my husband raved about this. i will be using this recipe again.
Perfect and super easy.
These are great meatballs. I baked them longer than the recipe said but we like them to hold up in the sauce. My family really enjoyed dinner. Thanks!!
Just made these! Eating right out of the oven and they are awesome!

I have made several different Italian meatball recipes and this one inspired me to write a review. I wasn't quite sure about the red pepper flakes, but its gives a surprising kick and the perfect amount of heat. I cut the recipe in half and only used ground beef. I paired the meatballs with homemade spaghetti noodles and sauce (bought myself a pasta maker attachment for my kitchen aid mixer, since I don't bake) and have been having fun finding great pasta recipes. This is my new go to meatball recipe. Love Chef John's prime rib recipe, too...just an FYI

The only changes I made was omitting the parsley and onion. I did add a bit of onion powder. After baking in the over, the meatballs were starting to fall apart as I transferred them to a pot of sauce. Other than falling apart, the flavor was ok. Will not make them again!
Fallowed the ingredients to a tee, instead of frying and baking, I used my air fryer, 350 and 8 minutes then flip for another 8 minutes, family loved them.
Meatballic perfection! Followed the recipe and it came out great. I needed two baking sheets for the 33 meatballs produced. I will make this again.

I saw a review that wasn’t too happy with the oven baking with the meatballs of this recipe. I ended up baking the meatballs for 35 minutes. I even raised the temp after the first 20 minutes check-in to 465 degrees to get some browning on the meatballs. Dem balls are gonna simmer in sauce for the next hour so I wasn’t too worried about them drying out. They turned out just fine. For the comment that said that it was too salty I figure they used maybe an Italian pork sausage as their mince or table salt. I used New York Style sausage as my pork mince. You can taste the extra seasoning from using a prepared sausage in this meatball.
Delious meatballs. Will make again in the future

I made these a month ago and froze 1/2 for spaghetti and used the other 1/2 for meatball parm subs and my family said don't make anything other than these from now on. We loved them. Making a triple batch today to freeze for quick meal options.
Easy to follow, really tender and TASTY! I used dried herbs and ground hot Paprika instead of hot red pepper. Very nice, even with the substitutions. 😄
Great recipe! Turning the leftovers into meatball subs.

This is my go to meatball recipe. The meatballs come out perfectly each and every time that I make them. They bake perfectly and I believe that refrigerating the mixed ingredients is the key. The texture is perfect and the flavor is delicious. Just the right herbs and spices! A family favorite. Thank you Chef John for this excellent recipe on this National Meatball Day! 3/9/22.

These taste very similar to the meatballs at our local Italian restaurant. The measurements for the parsley and onion are kind of vague, I used 1/3 cup fresh parsley and 1 cup chopped onion. I will make again for sure.
Fabulous! Thanks - this was one of the best recipes I ever made.

These came out perfect! I read other reviews and, since it sounded like they came out a little soggy for some people, I increased the bread crumbs a bit and did them in an air fryer to take advantage of the grate and let the grease drip down, that also allowed me to adjust the time and temp between batches. I’ll definitely use this recipe again.

I made it! I used 2 lbs of hamburger meat. I have a son who hates onions, so I made two batches. ...half with onions, have without. Otherwise, I had all ingredients and followed directions. They turned out fantastic! So delicious! We had sandwich rolls and made meatball sandwiches. My son rated them at an 8 but said they'd have been a 10 if I'd made my own sauce. I make a mean sauce! 😁 Very happy I found this recipe. It is a top ten for those who enjoy cooking with love! ♡♡♡ God bless us all!

This is the fourth time that I have followed this recipe and consistently receive praise from everyone who eats these Italian meatballs! This most recent time I used an equal combination of ground beef, pork and veal (1/3 each per pound) and it seemed to enhance the moistness of the meatballs. Absolutely delicious! Thanks, Chef John!
Chef John nailed it! I've made meatballs for years - but not recently- so I checked for a base recipe." Sometimes I used oatmeal (very good) but today I followed the recipe as written. Thanks, Chef.

Five star flavor wise but a few things LOTS of liquid. I would definitely reduce egg from two to one, omit the broth in the breadcrumbs or add another 1/4 cup or so of breadcrumbs dry. I had to take them out of the oven drain the liquid off and put them back in for a few more minutes. Despite the liquid the consistency was good Decent browning considering it wasn’t pan fried, pan frying is way more time consuming & messy so loved that this is an oven backed recipe Mine didn’t hold their shape so if that’s important to you I suggest chilling for longer or rolling smaller. It is also possible I mixed a little to much and the meat I bought (meatloaf mix) was very soft so I’m sure that contributed Still the taste was delicious! The recipe was unclear about the garlic—I added it to the onion at the end of cooking, but not sure if they were indicating to add it raw
Perfection!

Best meatball recipe BY FAR, and I have tried dozens over the years. Even had my Italian mother-in-law try to teach me hers, but these were better. I think soaking the breadcrumbs in the milk and sautéing the onions before mixing are the game-changers, as most of the recipe ingredients themselves are similar or the same to most of the others I’ve seen. Btw I bake the meatballs on an elevated roasting sheet before putting in my Sunday gravy, and the results are excellent.

Dumped out the liquid and turned my oven broiler on high just to give them a little color. But, it was a huge success.
M y wife is quite picky. So, this is a major win.
They were just okay. but that isn’t bad, I’m a cook and I’m picky.

This is by far the best meatball recipe that I have attempted and I have my dear friend's italian nona's meatball recipe. These are good in sauce, as is, however you want to serve them. Super moist, great flavor. I added more salt to mine (I also do a test run of one meatball to see how it cooks). I baked mine a little longer to get some caramelization and then dropped them into a pomodoro sauce. Thank you Chef John!
